result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle Richard Lein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 p.m. on 10/26/2022.

miscConds.notes:
Complete Batterers Intervention Program.
Complete parenting classes.
Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.

No contact with victim until the start of BIP and has engaged in mental health treatment. Third party contact for the purpose of time with children.
No contact with firearms.

Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation.  Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment
-Court set restitution at zero.

Court advised defendant of appellant rights.
Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle Richard Lein

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kyle Richard Lein appeared by video.  Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt appeared by video for Kyle Richard Lein.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea and sentencing hearing held. Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Court held colloquy with the defendant regarding his right to have an in-person hearing. Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Complete Parenting Classes.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- No contact with victim until the start of BIP and has engaged in mental health treatment.
- Third party contact for the purpose of time with children. 
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
- Court set restitution at zero.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 10/26/22.

Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.

Defendant Kyle Richard Lein appeared by video.  Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt appeared by video for Kyle Richard Lein.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Due to court calendar congestion, court is unable to hear the matter. Case is adjourned for a plea and sentencing hearing in Branch 29.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Kyle Richard Lein in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel advises that they are in a resolution posture. Case adjourned for a Plea/Sentencing hearing to Br 29.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Kyle Richard Lein in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a plea and sentencing hearing. State advises of possible new charges and requests a scheduling conference. Court vacates the stayed bench warrant.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights, filed.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, filed.

Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt in court.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a scheduling conference.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Defense requests a plea and sentencing hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Status conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel was recently retained and requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Actual Date Bond Posted with *West Allis
02-11-22

Defendant Kyle Richard Lein in court.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-trial conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defendant requests time to hire his own attorney. Court orders matter adjourned for a status of counsel hearing in Branch 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kyle Richard Lein in court.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 29.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Written No Contact Order signed and filed.  Defendant to have no contact with   SMD or her children
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/18/22 @ 1:30p
